metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39842 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.19. Inpxa3xx_gcu_write in drivers/video/fbdev/pxa3xx-gcu.c, the count parameterhas a type conflict of size_t versus int, causing an integer overflow andbypassing the size check. After that, because it is used as the thirdargument to copy_from_user(), a heap overflow may occur. NOTE: the originaldiscoverer disputes that the overflow can actually happen.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
